Key Match Events: Haris hit a six off Ebadot
Haris launched an Ebadot short ball over square leg
Pre-Game Insights: Bangladesh went left-arm spin to open the innings
Pakistan promoted the left-handed Mohammad Nawaz up the order to mess with the Bangladesh spinners
The game keeps see-sawing all the way through
Bangladesh's bowlers have been so impressive, digging it into this off-paced pitch
Pakistan's main man, their left-arm hero, gets it to go the other way and the batter was little more than a cardboard cutout
Post-Match Reflections: Pakistan won by 5 wickets (with 11 balls remaining)
Bangladesh's captain Shakib Al Hasan was not impressed with the lbw decision against him and had to be forced off
Miscellaneous Highlights: Nurul Hasan dives for a catch but ends up going past the ball and dropping it
Pakistan won by 5 wickets (with 11 balls remaining)
Others: Rain delays led to the game being postponed until the next day
The game went into 15 innings before a decisive home run by Mike Trout
